algorithm_technique: Find the rook, then scan in four directions (up, down, left, right) until a piece or boundary is hit.
problem_summary_simple: Count how many pawns a white rook can capture on a chessboard, avoiding blocking pieces.
problem_summary_technical: Locate the rook on the 8x8 board. Iterate in four cardinal directions, counting pawns until a bishop, pawn, or board edge is encountered.
key_insights: The board size is fixed at 8x8, making the complexity constant.
The key is to correctly implement the scanning logic in each of the four directions, stopping at the first obstruction.
Bishops and pawns act as blockers, so the scan must terminate upon encountering them, regardless of whether they are captured.
